raw_response:
Thought: To determine if a number is prime, we needs to check if it has any divisors other than 1 and itself. We can loop from 2 up to the square root of the number, checking for divisibility at each step. If no divisors are found, then it's prime.

```ruby
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num < 2 # Numbers less than 2 aren't prime
  (2..Math.sqrt(num)).none? { |i| num % i == 0 }
end

final_answer(answer: "Ruby function to check if a number is prime.")
```
